titleStmt.title: A refutation of sundry reprehensions, cauils, and false sleightes, by which M. Whitaker laboureth to deface the late English translation, and Catholike annotations of the new Testament, and the booke of Discouery of heretical corruptions. By William Rainolds, student of diuinitie in the English Colledge at Rhemes
titleStmt.author: Rainolds, William, 1544?-1594.

notesStmt.note: A reply to Whitaker's "Ad Nicolai Sanderi demonstrationes quadraginta", in defence of the Douai translation of the Bible and of "A discoverie of the manifold corruptions of the Holy Scriptures by the heretikes of our daies" by Gregory Martin.
The text proper begins new pagination and register, with caption title: A refutation of M. Whitakers reprehension ..
Includes index and a final errata leaf.
Quire 2P occurs in two settings; 2P1r line 11 is (1) "See Heauen." or (2) "107. See Heauen.".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
